doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Display a multiple sequence alignment in pretty format

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

xhtml:div.label:
Similarity scoring matrix file?
Eblosum30 Eblosum35 Eblosum40 Eblosum45 Eblosum50 Eblosum55 Eblosum60 Eblosum62 Eblosum62-12 Eblosum65 Eblosum70 Eblosum75 Eblosum80 Eblosum85 Eblosum90 Eblosumn Ednafull Ednamat Ednasimple Epam10 Epam100 Epam110 Epam120 Epam130 Epam140 Epam150 Epam160 Epam170 Epam180 Epam190 Epam20 Epam200 Epam210 Epam220 Epam230 Epam240 Epam250 Epam260 Epam270 Epam280 Epam290 Epam30 Epam300 Epam310 Epam320 Epam330 Epam340 Epam350 Epam360 Epam370 Epam380 Epam390 Epam40 Epam400 Epam410 Epam420 Epam430 Epam440 Epam450 Epam460 Epam470 Epam480 Epam490 Epam50 Epam500 Epam60 Epam70 Epam80 Epam90 Sssub
This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

The number or the name of the reference sequence?
If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is always shown in full and is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.

Display the reference sequence at the bottom?
Yes No
If this is true then the reference sequence is displayed at the bottom of the alignment instead of the top.
What to show All of the sequences Identities between the sequences Non-identities between the sequences Similarities between the sequences Dissimilarities between the sequences
Output order of the sequences Input order - no change Alphabetical order of the names Similarity to the reference sequence

Show similar residues in lower-case?
Yes No
If this is set True, then when -show is set to 'Similarities' or 'Non-identities' and a residue is similar but not identical to the reference sequence residue, it will be changed to lower-case. If -show is set to 'All' then non-identical, non-similar residues will be changed to lower-case. If this is False then no change to the case of the residues is made on the basis of their similarity to the reference sequence.

Display the consensus line?
Yes No
If this is true then the consensus line is displayed.

Regions to put in uppercase (eg: 4-57,78-94)?
Regions to put in uppercase. If this is left blank, then the sequence case is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are separated by any non-digit, non-alpha character. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45, 56-78 1:45, 67=99;765..888 1,5,8,10,23,45,57,99

Number the sequences?
Yes No
If this option is true then a line giving the positions in the alignment is displayed every 10 characters above the alignment.

Display ruler?
Yes No
If this option is true then a ruler line marking every 5th and 10th character in the alignment is displayed.
Width of sequence to display (value greater than or equal to 1)

Length of margin for sequence names (value greater than or equal to -1)?
This sets the length of the left-hand margin for sequence names. If the margin is set at 0 then no margin and no names are displayed. If the margin is set to a value that is less than the length of a sequence name then the sequence name is displayed truncated to the length of the margin. If the margin is set to -1 then the minimum margin width that will allow all the sequence names to be displayed in full plus a space at the end of the name will automatically be selected.
Use html formatting Yes No

Regions to colour in html (eg: 4-57 red 78-94 green)?
Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.

Plurality check % for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

Threshold above which the consensus is given in uppercase?
Sets the threshold for the scores of the positive matches above which the consensus is in upper-case and below which the consensus is in lower-case. By default this is set to be half of the (weight-adjusted) number of sequences in the alignment.

Required % of identities at a position for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.

Use gap characters in consensus?
Yes No
If this option is true then gap characters can appear in the consensus. The alternative is 'N' for nucleotide, or 'X' for protein

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is always shown in full and is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.
If this is true then the reference sequence is displayed at the bottom of the alignment instead of the top.

If this is set True, then when -show is set to 'Similarities' or 'Non-identities' and a residue is similar but not identical to the reference sequence residue, it will be changed to lower-case. If -show is set to 'All' then non-identical, non-similar residues will be changed to lower-case. If this is False then no change to the case of the residues is made on the basis of their similarity to the reference sequence.
If this is true then the consensus line is displayed.

Regions to put in uppercase. If this is left blank, then the sequence case is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are separated by any non-digit, non-alpha character. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45, 56-78 1:45, 67=99;765..888 1,5,8,10,23,45,57,99
If this option is true then a line giving the positions in the alignment is displayed every 10 characters above the alignment.
If this option is true then a ruler line marking every 5th and 10th character in the alignment is displayed.

This sets the length of the left-hand margin for sequence names. If the margin is set at 0 then no margin and no names are displayed. If the margin is set to a value that is less than the length of a sequence name then the sequence name is displayed truncated to the length of the margin. If the margin is set to -1 then the minimum margin width that will allow all the sequence names to be displayed in full plus a space at the end of the name will automatically be selected.

Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.
Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

Sets the threshold for the scores of the positive matches above which the consensus is in upper-case and below which the consensus is in lower-case. By default this is set to be half of the (weight-adjusted) number of sequences in the alignment.
Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.
If this option is true then gap characters can appear in the consensus. The alternative is 'N' for nucleotide, or 'X' for protein

comment.text: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

parameter.name: e_width
parameter.prompt: Width of sequence to display (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.code: ("", " -width=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 1 is required

interface.label: Width of sequence to display (value greater than or equal to 1)

parameter.name: e_margin
parameter.prompt: Length of margin for sequence names (value greater than or equal to -1)

format.code: ("", " -margin=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to -1 is required

comment.text: This sets the length of the left-hand margin for sequence names. If the margin is set at 0 then no margin and no names are displayed. If the margin is set to a value that is less than the length of a sequence name then the sequence name is displayed truncated to the length of the margin. If the margin is set to -1 then the minimum margin width that will allow all the sequence names to be displayed in full plus a space at the end of the name will automatically be selected.

interface.label:
Length of margin for sequence names (value greater than or equal to -1)?
This sets the length of the left-hand margin for sequence names. If the margin is set at 0 then no margin and no names are displayed. If the margin is set to a value that is less than the length of a sequence name then the sequence name is displayed truncated to the length of the margin. If the margin is set to -1 then the minimum margin width that will allow all the sequence names to be displayed in full plus a space at the end of the name will automatically be selected.

If the margin is set to a value that is less than the length of a sequence name then the sequence name is displayed truncated to the length of the margin. If the margin is set to -1 then the minimum margin width that will allow all the sequence names to be displayed in full plus a space at the end of the name will automatically be selected.

parameter.name: e_highlight
parameter.prompt: Regions to colour in html (eg: 4-57 red 78-94 green)

comment.text: Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.

interface.label:
Regions to colour in html (eg: 4-57 red 78-94 green)?
Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Regions to colour if formatting for HTML. If this is left blank, then the sequence is left alone. A set of regions is specified by a set of pairs of positions. The positions are integers. They are followed by any valid HTML font colour. Examples of region specifications are: 24-45 blue 56-78 orange 1-100 green 120-156 red A file of ranges to colour (one range per line) can be specified as '@filename'.

parameter.name: e_plurality
parameter.prompt: Plurality check % for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)

format.code: ("", " -plurality=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0.0 is required
Value less than or equal to 100.0 is required

comment.text: Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

interface.label:
Plurality check % for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

parameter.name: e_setcase
parameter.prompt: Threshold above which the consensus is given in uppercase

comment.text: Sets the threshold for the scores of the positive matches above which the consensus is in upper-case and below which the consensus is in lower-case. By default this is set to be half of the (weight-adjusted) number of sequences in the alignment.

interface.label:
Threshold above which the consensus is given in uppercase?
Sets the threshold for the scores of the positive matches above which the consensus is in upper-case and below which the consensus is in lower-case. By default this is set to be half of the (weight-adjusted) number of sequences in the alignment.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Sets the threshold for the scores of the positive matches above which the consensus is in upper-case and below which the consensus is in lower-case. By default this is set to be half of the (weight-adjusted) number of sequences in the alignment.

parameter.name: e_identity
parameter.prompt: Required % of identities at a position for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)

format.code: ("", " -identity=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0.0 is required
Value less than or equal to 100.0 is required

comment.text: Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.

interface.label:
Required % of identities at a position for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.

comment.text: If this option is true then gap characters can appear in the consensus. The alternative is 'N' for nucleotide, or 'X' for protein

interface.label:
Use gap characters in consensus?
Yes No
If this option is true then gap characters can appear in the consensus. The alternative is 'N' for nucleotide, or 'X' for protein
